property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: School is one of the most important locations in Hometown, both as a place where we [[Kris]]'s classmates are introduced, as well as the location of the [[Closet Dark World]] and [[Card Kingdom]].

property.name: description
property.value: Dreemurr Residence is the home of [[Kris]], [[Toriel]], [[Asriel]] and formerly [[Asgore]].

property.name: page
property.value: Dreemurr Residence

property.name: description
property.value: Toriel can be seen here during most of [[Hometown]] visits.

property.name: description
property.value: Catty appears in front of her house in [[Chapter 1]] and talks to [[Kris]] about her sister, [[Catti]], [[Asriel]], and [[Bratty]]. In [[Chapter 2]], she's off to [[QC's Diner]] with the rest of the family.

property.name: description
property.value: Dad Cat appears in front of his family house in [[Chapter 1]], talking about how [[Asriel]] (who he named "Doug") didn't like his wife's cooking. In [[Chapter 2]], he's off to [[QC's Diner]] to support [[Catti]].

property.name: page
property.value: Dad Cat

property.name: description
property.value: Bratty can be found in front of her house during [[Chapter 1]], talking to [[Kris]] mostly about [[Catty]].

property.name: description
property.value: Asgore is found in his flower shop in [[Chapter 1]], giving [[Kris]] a big hug and a bouquet for [[Toriel]].

property.name: page
property.value: Asgore Dreemurr

property.name: description
property.value: This NPC, whose verbal quirks are similar to those of [[ut:Mettaton|Mettaton]], doesn't let [[Kris]] into their house and describes themselves as a "nobody," appearing surprised that Kris wants to talk to them.

property.name: description
property.value: This group of dogs, returning from ''[[ut:Undertale|Undertale]]''<nowiki />'s [[ut:Snowdin Canine Unit|Snowdin Canine Unit]], is said to have attempted to sneak into a large house over the holidays. If talking to [[Undyne]] about "[[Dark World]]", she accidentally unlocks their cell, and they escape.

property.name: page
property.value: Wet-Nose Bandits

property.name: description
property.value: In [[Chapter 2]], Undyne appears inside the police station, guarding the jail cell of the [[Wet-Nose Bandits]].

property.name: description
property.value: Napstablook has become a police officer by accident, but cannot quit due to their cousins relying on them. In [[Chapter 1]], they don't let [[Kris]] into the police station, and simply close the blinds.

property.name: description
property.value: During [[Chapter 1]]'s epilogue, Undyne is seen on the street attempting to direct traffic by yelling at everyone to get out of her way. She appears to not recognize [[Alphys]]'s name. In [[Chapter 2]], she is instead in the [[Police Station]].

property.name: description
property.value: In [[Chapter 1]], Berdly works at the [[library]]'s desk, mocking [[Kris]] for not returning ''How to Draw Dragons'' for 2583 days.

property.name: description
property.value: Interacting with this toilet several times leads to additional flavor text.

properties.property: It's a computer desk. There are many boxes under it filled with old books. On the computer's desktop is a folder called "EPIC games Stuff!!!!" It's a poorly-drawn design for a game... Seems the last boss is a creature with giant rainbow wings. Doesn't seem like this game ever saw the light of day...

'''Chapter 1:''' There are CDs under the bed. Classical, jazz, religious ska... There's also a game console. It has one normal controller, and one knock-off one. '''Chapter 2:''' Underneath the bed is an old cartridge of "Cat Petters RPG". "catti & catty" can be seen faintly written on it in worn gel pen.

The drawer is mostly empty, except for... '''Save slot 1:''' A school cross country shirt with a tear in it. '''Save slot 2:''' A very old school ID with an embarrassing haircut. '''Save slot 3:''' A coupon book. Every coupon is for half-off a large pizza. All the coupons expired before the book's print date. '''After interacting:''' There's nothing useful in the drawer.

property.name: description
property.value: The door is locked.

properties.property: '''Chapter 1:''' There are crayons in the drawer. Their labels have long faded, and there's no green. '''Chapter 2:''' (... How to Draw Dragons is at the bottom of the drawer.) (The purple character on the cover is dressed... immodestly.) (Your brother will never return this book.)

'''Chapter 1:''' There are many books. Tales of Snails - A Story Book. Snails Do Not Have Tails - A Scientific Refutation. Can Snails Help Your Garden? Um, Not Really. And a signed copy of The History of Humans and Monsters, by Gerson Boom. '''After interacting:''' There's no time to read anything right now. '''Chapter 2:''' (There's no time to read books. Just generally.)
It's a sink. You could wash your hands here. ... but, isn't the sink in the bathroom better? '''After [[Susie]] and [[Toriel]] finish making pie:''' There is some white fur stuck in the drain.
There's some cinnamony batter caked on the stovetop. '''After [[Susie]] and [[Toriel]] make pie:''' (It's a butterscotch-cinnamon pie.) (It's still cooling.)
It's a trashcan. Somehow, it's emitting a pleasant floral scent. '''After bringing the bouquet from [[Asgore]]:''' Somehow, its floral scent has increased.

property.name: description
property.value: It's a landline phone. But you already have a cell phone.

properties.property: It's the TV. Doesn't seem to even be plugged in anymore. '''Chapter 2+:''' Looks like it's plugged in, but it's dusty.

property.name: description
property.value: It's a book of hymns.

properties.property: On the shower ledge, there's a small container of apple-scented shampoo. ... and a gallon-sized container of pet shampoo. '''Chapter 2, during bathroom cutscene:''' (No need for it.) '''Chapter 2, after bathroom cutscene:''' (The apple-scented shampoo feels lighter than usual.)
You looked inside the sink cupboard. There's... A can of Ice-E's Cool Boys Body Spray "Spray For The Boys," Flamin' Hot Pizza Flavor. It seems to be almost entirely full.

property.name: description
property.value: There's a photo on the fridge. It's of you, your mother, and your brother.

property.name: description
property.value: The door is locked.

property.name: description
property.value: In [[Chapter 2]], [[Kris]] and [[Susie]] (as well as [[Noelle]] and [[Berdly]] previously) use this door to enter the chapter's [[Dark World]].

property.name: page
property.value: Cyber World

property.name: description
property.value: In this closet there is a [[Dark World]] persisting through all [[chapter]]s. In [[Chapter 1]], [[Kris]] and [[Susie]] land in [[??????]] upon entrance, whereas in [[Chapter 2]] onwards they land in [[Castle Town]].

property.name: page
property.value: Closet Dark World

property.name: description
property.value: Interacting with this bed allows Kris to enter the [[chapter]]'s [[Dark World]], if that Dark World was visited at least once before.

property.name: description
property.value: During the [[Chapter 1]] ending cutscene, [[Kris]] rips their [[SOUL]] out in this location, throws it in the cage, and pulls out a knife.

property.name: description
property.value: During the [[Chapter 2]] ending, [[Kris]] rips out their [[SOUL]] in the bathroom, leaves through the window, then comes back.

property.name: description
property.value: After returning from [[Card Kingdom]], [[Kris]] and [[Susie]] return in this classroom, which appears to contain real-world representations of [[Darkners]] from that [[Dark World]].

property.name: description
property.value: Near this bunker, mus_smile (sound associated with [[W.D. Gaster]]) can be heard. In [[Chapter 2]], [[Monster Kid]] and [[Snowy]] appear here to talk about rumors that [[Kris]] has been spreading about this bunker, before [[Susie]] scares them away.

property.name: description
property.value: Near this gate in [[Chapter 1]], [[Noelle]] can be found waiting after returning from the [[hospital]]. She talks to [[Kris]] about [[Susie]].
